post_text:
A case of molestation of a foreign tourist woman has come to light in Jaipur, Rajasthan. Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal shared the video on Twitter, demanding action against the accused. He sent the video to Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot and the Rajasthan Police and demanded immediate attention to the matter.

Police started the investigation after the video went viral, although the incident location is unknown. Sindhi Camp police station has been given the instruction to investigate by the cityâ€™s municipal police control room.

As per the viral video, the accused can be seen repeatedly touching the female tourist. During this, the foreign woman looks very uncomfortable. The woman was accompanied by a male companion who found the behaviour of the accused a bit strange. The Delhi Commission for Women chief wrote on Twitter, â€œJust saw this video where a man can be seen inappropriately touching a foreign tourist. This is so embarrassing. Tagging Ashok Gehlot and Rajasthan Police for action These incidents are spoiling the name of the country".

Source - News24

Follow @mewsinsta for trending news and informative carousel posts
#molestation #harassment #jaipur #mews

post_text:
Today is #internationalwomensday ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

ğŸ‘‰ The theme is #inspireinclusion and weâ€™ve chosen to highlight some of the issues including discrimination, gender inequality and sexual harassment that we see as healthcare professionals ğŸ’™

ğŸ‘‰ Equality is the goal ğŸ¯, and although progress has been made, sadly we are not close to that in the healthcare profession.

In 2021 the BMA found the following:

ğŸ‘‰ 91% of female #doctors had experienced sexism in the past two years

ğŸ‘‰ 60% of #nurses said they had experienced sexual harassment at work

ğŸ‘‰ 56% of female doctors received unwanted verbal comments relating to their gender in the last two years

ğŸŒ Itâ€™s all our responsibility to lift the world that we live in to new standards.

ğŸ’­ Collectively as individuals, groups, organisations and industries we can create a gender equal world. A world free of bias, stereotypes, and discrimination.

ğŸŒ A world thatâ€™s diverse, equitable, and inclusive. A world where difference is valued and celebrated. Together we can forge womenâ€™s equality. ğŸ‘

Equality is the goal and equity is the ticket to get there - not just for today but always. ğŸ™Œ

ğŸ’™ Collectively itâ€™s all our responsibility to raise the standard. ğŸ’™

Please consider downloading The Student Dose Podcast Tackling Sexism with @scrubsurvivors - available on all major streaming platforms ğŸ’™

#werewithyou #iwd #iwd2024 #equality #equity #harassment #genderdiscimination #genderequality #doctors #doctorsofintagram #genderbias #youokaydoc #youokaynurse #nhsworkers #nhs #inclusiveemployment

ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ a greatly important topic! Happy international womenâ€™s day everyone!

Happy international womenâ€™s day to all the amazing women out there fighting every day.

In Nigeria, we have Pidgin English which is a combination of Igbo, Yoruba, Hausa, English, French and several other languages. It's heavily influenced by the region where you are. Like when I schooled 4 hours away from home, their version is heavily influenced by the Bini language. For example, you can say something "una sabi who get that ride" = do you know who owns that car? Una is borrowed from Igbo. Sabi is borrowed from Yoruba.
Iâ€™m going to try and work â€œlinguistic imperialismâ€ into my work conversations this week.
I learn something new from every post! Thank you!

WOW. So Manglish (Malaysian English) & Singlish (Singaporean English) is a form of English-based creole. Thereâ€™s a restaurant in London called Roti King and on the wall is this big sentence â€œWei macha, you want to makan here or tapau?â€ In this sentence is a mix of Chinese, English, Tamil, and Malay and for a native it makes complete sense. ğŸ¤¯ My mind is blown.
Thereâ€™s also Martiniquan creole

post_text:
New York City settles a $17.5 million lawsuit with Jamilla Clark and Arwa Aziz, two Muslim-American women who alleged police harassment. â 
â 
The settlement, approved by District Judge Analisa Torres, includes reforms regarding the removal of religious attire during police procedures. â 
â 
Estimated payouts for eligible claimants range from $7,824 to $13,125. â 
â 
The lawsuit, filed in 2018, stemmed from the women's claim of feeling shamed and violated when officers forced them to remove their hijabs for mugshots after arrest.

post_text:
Algerian boxer Imane Khelif won gold at this yearâ€™s Paris Olympics when she beat Chinaâ€™s Yang Liu in the womenâ€™s welterweight final.

Throughout this yearâ€™s Games, Khelif was at the centre of a vicious dispute about her gender eligibility. Despite being born female, not identifying as transgender or intersex and having the International Olympic Committee asserting her biological gender as female, she was subjected to a wave of online abuse.

Now the boxer is filing a cyberbullying lawsuit. In a statement sent to Variety, the Paris Prosecutor's Office said it will be conducting an investigation into the counts of â€œcyber harassment due to gender, public insult because of gender, public incitement to discrimination and public insult because of origin.â€

In the lawsuit J.K Rowling and Elon Musk have both been named over alleged â€œacts of aggravated cyber harassmentâ€. Musk and Rowling were heavily involved in the discourse around Khelifâ€™s gender. In one post, Rowling shared a picture of Khelif accusing her of being a man who was â€œenjoying the distress of a woman heâ€™s just punched in the head.â€ Musk, meanwhile, shared a post from swimmer Riley Gaines that claimed â€œmen donâ€™t belong in womenâ€™s sports.â€ and quoted the message by writing: â€œAbsolutely.â€

While the lawsuit mentions these famous figures, it is actually filed against X, which under French law means it was filed against unknown persons, meaning anyone who may have written hateful messages can be investigated. This means that Donald Trump could also be investigated, as he took to X posting a picture from Khelifâ€™s first fight saying â€œI will keep men out of womenâ€™s sports!â€

post_text:
Whilst Joanneâ€™s fantasy has helped to free people in the past, continuing to support it, despite you now being free and despite knowing what she is, means you become the oppressor of so many others. Others who, thanks to her, will never know the freedom you feel today.

Ask yourself this: is it worth throwing an entire vulnerable community under a bus for decades to come, just so you can cling on to a few moments?

#BriannaGhey #Transphobia #Hate #TransWomen #TransRights #EqualityAct #Discrimination #Harassment #Victimisation #BeTheChange #StopFundingHate

Social activist and former wife of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) leader Imran Khan, Jemima Khan, has disclosed that she has blocked all emails from Pakistan due to a wave of cyber-harassment.

Jemima announced this on her Instagram and X (formerly Twitter) accounts, linking the harassment to critics of Imran Khan.

In her message, she explained, â€œTo friends in Pakistan trying to reach me, Iâ€™ve had to block all emails from Pakistan due to a cyber harassment campaign, most likely driven by PTIâ€™s desperate rivals. Since Twitter/X is banned in Pakistan by these same rivals, only those using VPNs will see this.â€
